title: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not being correctly determined.
OB: When using the new class wizard, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank when it should default to the current type in the editor.
EB: In Build 20011106, with a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button should automatically populate the 'Enclosing Type' field with the current type in the editor.
SR:
1. Open a .java file in the editor.
2. Click on the 'New Class' button.
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field to verify that it is automatically populated with the current type in the editor.
